case_vignette: A 2-day-old female is noted to have a rash all over the body and distorted feet at birth! A 24 week ultrasound was remarkable for bilateral shortening of the long bones! Physical examination demonstrates light, fine yellow scales along curvilinear distribution on the chest, bilateral upper and lower extremities on background diffuse erythema! The bilateral feet are turned inward with plantar aspect almost sideways! An X-ray of the knees demonstrate focal dot-like calcifications in the epiphyses!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash all over my body and my feet are turned inward.
How long have you had the rash and noticed the inward-turning of your feet?
I've had the rash and inward-turning feet since birth.
Has anyone else in your family had similar symptoms?
I am not aware of anyone else in my family having similar symptoms.
Have you previously consulted a healthcare provider about these symptoms, and were any diagnoses made or treatments given?
I have been examined by a healthcare provider since birth, but I am not aware of any specific diagnoses made or treatments given yet.
Do you have any other symptoms or health issues associated with the rash or the inward-turning of your feet? For example, joint pain, muscle weakness, or difficulty moving?
I have not experienced any joint pain, muscle weakness, or difficulty moving.
Final Diagnosis: Arthrogryposis multiplex congenita

I have a rash all over my body and my feet are turned inward.
How long have you had the rash and the inward turning of your feet?
